items.title: Report: Philip Rivers staying at St. Michael Catholic, for now
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Philip Rivers’ NFL coaching career will have to wait. The long-time veteran quarterback, who’s still under contract with the Indianapolis Colts, has withdrawn his name from consideration for the Buffalo Bills’ vacant head coaching position, according to The Athletic. The team announced it had interviewed Rivers, 44, on Friday. His decision apparently was [...]

items.title: Philip Rivers: From Colts’ QB to interviewing for Bills’ vacant head coaching position
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – If the past two months have shown Philip Rivers anything, it’s to never say never. After being lured out of a five-year retirement by the Indianapolis Colts in mid-December when quarterback Daniel Jones suffered a season-ending Achilles injury, one of the more accomplished quarterbacks in NFL history reportedly is being interviewed by the [...]

items.title: 2025 Colts Rookie Review: Justin Walley and Hunter Wohler on recovering from injuries, preparing for 2026 season
items.summary: Walley and Wohler each sustained their respective injuries during the 2025 preseason, but both expect to be fully healthy for 2026.

items.title: Colts confirm FBI's investigation into death of former owner Jim Irsay
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — The Indianapolis Colts are aware of an FBI investigation into the death of former owner Jim Irsay, sources told FOX59/CBS4. Irsay died on May 21, 2025, at the age of 65. While aware of the FBI investigation, the Colts said the organization has not been contacted by the federal agency nor has it [...]

items.title: 2025 Colts Rookie Review: Riley Leonard takes advantages of his opportunities
items.summary: Leonard appeared in five games (one start) as a rookie, completing 39 passes for 415 yards and two touchdowns. He also had six carries for 27 yards and two touchdowns.

items.title: NFL Combine to remain in Indianapolis in 2027, 2028
items.summary: The NFL Combine has been held in Indianapolis every year since 1987, owing to the city's intentional efforts to create as streamlined a scouting process as possible.

items.title: Spencer Shrader on rehab journey to regain Colts’ kicking chores from Blake Grupe
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Blake Grupe has a long-term place with the Indianapolis Colts. It’s the short-term that’s the issue. Grupe replaced a PAT-deficient Michael Badgley, who had replaced an injured Spencer Shrader in a season that saw the Colts use three kickers for the first time in franchise history. He more than met the challenge and [...]

items.title: Eagles interested in Colts’ OC Jim Bob Cooter
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The latest season of change across the NFL landscape could include the Indianapolis Colts’ offense. The Philadelphia Eagles have requested permission to talk with Colts’ offensive coordinator Jim Bob Cooter, according to NFL Network. The Eagles created an opening at the coordinator position last week when they relieved Kevin Petullo of those duties [...]

items.title: Daniel Jones, Alec Pierce priorities in Colts’ free-agent group
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The question isn’t ‘if’ the Indianapolis Colts will re-sign Daniel Jones and Alec Pierce. The overarching issue: How much will it take? As Chris Ballard looked back at his team’s latest season of unfulfilled expectations last week, he also looked ahead to what must be done moving forward. As is the case in [...]

items.title: Colts moving training camp to West 56th in 2027
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The Indianapolis Colts are moving again. Training camp, that is. The team announced Friday that it’s moving its summer training camp beginning in 2027 to its Indiana Farm Bureau Football Center on West 56th Street. The Colts’ final summer at Grand Park Sports Campus will be this July-August. For the past four-plus decades, the [...]

items.title: Colts to host 2027 Training Camp at Indiana Farm Bureau Football Center

items.title: Colts Harriet P. Irsay Fellow Isabel Diaz selected as Special Teams Coordinator for 2025 East-West Shrine Bowl East Team
items.summary: Diaz is in her third season with the Colts as a Harriet P. Irsay Fellow, and is one of 11 women with full-time NFL coaching jobs.

items.title: Colts rookie TE Tyler Warren added to Pro Bowl
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS -- After a record-setting rookie season, Indianapolis Colts tight end Tyler Warren is headed to the Pro Bowl. The NFL named Warren to the 2026 Pro Bowl Games as an injury replacement for Las Vegas Raiders tight end Brock Bowers. Warren is the 18th rookie tight end in NFL history selected for the Pro [...]

items.title: Colts TE Tyler Warren named to 2026 Pro Bowl
items.summary: Warren will take the place of Las Vegas Raiders tight end Brock Bowers, who is unable to participate due to injury.

items.title: Colts Blue Zone Podcast 456: A Critical Offseason for the Colts
items.summary: After a midseason fade that cost them a spot in the playoffs, the Indianapolis Colts face a critical offseason. First thing to consider: pending free agents. Who stays? Who goes? Dave Griffiths, Mike Chappell and Matt Adams offer their thoughts in the latest Blue Zone Podcast.

items.title: Colts Sunday Night 7-on-7 Series
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts are bringing back the Sunday Night 7-on-7 Series. Open to high school football players, the three-Sunday event provides a chance for off-season development. It uses an open gym format, which means players can sign up individually. The dates are Feb. 15, Feb. 22 and March 8. Each date has two different available [...]

items.title: 2025 Colts Rookie Review: Jalen Travis on adapting to playing right tackle, overall growth as a rookie
items.summary: Travis started the final four games of the 2025 season, primarily filling in for Braden Smith at right tackle – a position Travis hadn't played since his sophomore year of college.

items.summary: The Colts made the roster move on Tuesday.

items.summary: Warren finished his rookie season with a franchise-record 817 receiving yards and five total touchdowns.

items.title: Colts’ Quenton Nelson 2nd team All-Pro
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Quenton Nelson continues to set a high standard. The Indianapolis Colts’ veteran guard has been named second-team All-Pro, further establishing himself as one of the premier players in team history. Nelson has been named All-Pro in six of his eight seasons – first-team in 2018-20, second team in ’21, ’24 and this season. [...]

items.title: Colts G Quenton Nelson named Second-Team All-Pro
items.summary: Nelson was named an All-Pro for the sixth time in his career.

items.title: Colts CB Sauce Gardner, G Quenton Nelson named PFF All-Pros
items.summary: Gardner was named a first-team All-Pro and Nelson was named to the second team.

items.title: Colts RB Jonathan Taylor nominated for FedEx Ground Player of the Year
items.summary: Taylor led the NFL in total touchdowns (20) and rushing touchdowns (18) in 2025.

items.title: Colts’ Chris Ballard: Daniel Jones has ‘really bright future in Indianapolis’
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Confidence remains high. Carlie Irsay-Gordon made that clear Sunday night when she announced the Indianapolis Colts would move forward under the direction of general manager Chris Ballard and coach Shane Steichen. And Ballard reinforced that conviction during Thursday’s postscript following an 8-9 record and fifth consecutive season without a playoff appearance. “It wasn’t [...]

items.title: Colts Blue Zone Podcast 455: Ballard on Daniel Jones, Team's Trajectory
items.summary: In this episode of the Colts Blue Zone Podcast, Mike Chappell and Matt Adams discuss their takeaways from GM Chris Ballard's season-ending news conference. Topics include Daniel Jones' impending return, Alec Pierce's contract, the Sauce Gardner trade, DeForest Buckner's future and more. Find the Colts Blue Zone Podcast on YouTube, Apple Podcasts or Spotify.

items.title: Former Colts running back Randy McMillan dies
items.summary: McMillan, a 1981 first-round pick, scored 26 touchdowns for the Colts from 1981-1986.

items.title: Colts GM Chris Ballard talks Daniel Jones, Philip Rivers and late-season fade
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The Indianapolis Colts expect to roll with Daniel Jones at quarterback going forward. That was one of the main takeaways of general manager Chris Ballard’s season-ending news conference. Ballard addressed reporters for about 45 minutes on Thursday, covering everything from Jones’ future to the team’s late-season fade and the impact of bringing Philip [...]

items.title: Colts sign CB Robert Carter Jr. to reserve/future contract

items.title: Tom Moore, Peyton Manning's offensive coordinator and 62-year coaching veteran, retires
items.summary: Moore was the Colts' offensive coordinator from 1998-2009 and held the role of senior offensive assistant in 2010, meaning he was in Indianapolis for every year of Peyton Manning's tenure with the Colts.

items.title: Colts’ DeForest Buckner: ’Next season, I will be complete’
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – DeForest Buckner offered an indication he’ll return for 2026 despite a season-ending neck injury that had him considering retirement. On an Instagram post on Wednesday, the Indianapolis Colts’ defensive mainstay concluded by writing: “Next season, I will be complete.’’ That certainly can be seen as Buckner’s decision to return for ’26. That would [...]

items.title: Laiatu Latu ‘arrow up,’ but Colts’ draft investments in edge rushers have fallen short
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – A defensive overhaul might be in the Indianapolis Colts’ future. That future might not include cornerback Charvarius Ward, who’s going to discuss retirement with his family after suffering three concussions last season, or cornerstone tackle DeForest Buckner, who will at least mull over that possibility after undergoing surgery last week to repair a [...]

items.title: Colts QB Riley Leonard nominated for NFL Rookie of the Week for Week 18
items.summary: Leonard, in his first career start on Sunday, completed 21-of-34 passes for 270 yards and two touchdowns as well as three carries for 21 rushing yards and a touchdown.
